subject: to no longer live next door to a family with a trampoline
body:
1\. our neighbors had a party in their backyard last night and rather than being annoyed i was just reminded of my deep gratitude to no longer live next door to a family with a trampoline in their backyard.
 

2\. "[everywhere](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YF1R0hc5Q2I)" by fleetwood mac which is one of the songs that i heard playing through the walls and which i don't think is s tier fleetwood mac in an objective sense but is one of my favorite songs of theirs because it's so bouncy and bright, the push pull bopping back and forth of the rhythm under a chandelier of glittery synths.

3. [pre-made joint cones](https://www.amazon.com/RAW-Classic-Natural-Rolling-Included/dp/B08HSGX34Z/ref=sr_1_3?crid=1WNQIIVXALF7Z&keywords=joint+cones&qid=1685026256&sprefix=joint+cones%2Caps%2C145&sr=8-3) and the experience of using the little cardboard tube they put in the center to keep them from being crushed in the package to tamp down the weed you put inside as you pack one.
normalized_markdown:
1\. our neighbors had a party in their backyard last night and rather than being annoyed i was just reminded of my deep gratitude to no longer live next door to a family with a trampoline in their backyard.
 

2\. "[everywhere](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YF1R0hc5Q2I)" by fleetwood mac which is one of the songs that i heard playing through the walls and which i don't think is s tier fleetwood mac in an objective sense but is one of my favorite songs of theirs because it's so bouncy and bright, the push pull bopping back and forth of the rhythm under a chandelier of glittery synths.

3. [pre-made joint cones](https://www.amazon.com/RAW-Classic-Natural-Rolling-Included/dp/B08HSGX34Z/ref=sr_1_3?crid=1WNQIIVXALF7Z&keywords=joint+cones&qid=1685026256&sprefix=joint+cones%2Caps%2C145&sr=8-3) and the experience of using the little cardboard tube they put in the center to keep them from being crushed in the package to tamp down the weed you put inside as you pack one.
